boxContent.title: List of Solana ETF Filings Under SEC Review
boxContent.content:
The scene began in July 2024, right after the SEC approved spot ETFs of Bitcoin and Ethereum in the USA. After this, a number of asset managers from various investment firms filed to launch spot Solana ETFs. Even after the uncertainty on how the SEC classifies Solana, Bloomberg said that there is a 75% chance of Solana ETFs getting approved by the end of the year which can also change the Solana price prediction for the upcoming years. 

 

SEC is currently led by Chair Paul Atkins, who is more open to crypto products. It is a positive sign for the cryptos that follow the rules and regulations in monitoring the market and keep up with the pricing standards. Two Solana futures ETFs (called SOLZ and SOLT) are already listed, and the CME plans to launch Solana futures later this year. This progress supports the idea that a spot Solana ETF could be approved soon. 

 

Let’s see a list of the main players driving the push for Solana ETFs in the US.

 

1. VanEckSolana Trust

 

In June 2024, VanEck filed an S-1 registration statement with the SEC, becoming the first to take action. This is the first official effort to create a spot Solana ETF in the United States, and the fund would monitor SOL's market price closely. VanEck has an early-mover advantage in the competition for cryptocurrency ETFs because of its early application.

 

2. 21 Shares Core Solana ETF 

 

VanEck was quickly followed by 21Shares, which also filed an S-1 in June 2024. Ethereum and other cryptocurrency ETFs are already traded on the Cboe BZX Exchange, where the fund is planned to list. With this Solana filing, 21Shares continues to solidify its place as a major participant in cryptocurrency ETFs around the world.

 

3. Bitwise Solana ETF

 

Bitwise started the filing process in November 2024 by creating a legal trust in Delaware. Later, it removed its initial structure and filed a new S-1 directly with the SEC. In line with Bitwise's approach of looking for long-term cryptocurrency investment through reliable structures, the fund would effectively hold SOL.

 

4. Grayscale Solana ETF 

 

In January 2025, Grayscale submitted a proposal to convert its current Solana Trust (GSOL) into a spot exchange-traded fund (ETF). At the time of filing, GSOL's assets under management (AUM) were over $134 million. Grayscale's previous approach with its Ethereum and Bitcoin trusts is mirrored in this proposal, which might see the ETF listed on the NYSE Arca.

 

5. Canary Solana ETF 

 

Canary Capital's proposal, which was submitted between the end of 2024 and the beginning of 2025, was part of the mass submission of cryptocurrency ETF applications that followed the US presidential election. In an attempt to meet the increasing institutional interest in compliant SOL exposure, the company filed an S-1 for a spot Solana ETF.

 

6. Franklin Templeton Solana ETF 

 

In March 2025, Franklin Templeton, which oversees funds worth over $1.5 trillion, filed for both S-1 and 19b-4 forms. One of the most well-known institutional entries into the Solana ETF competition is its projected Solana ETF, which would be listed on the Cboe BZX Exchange.

 

7. Fidelity Solana ETF 

 

On behalf of Fidelity, the Cboe BZX Exchange filed a 19b-4 application for a potential spot Solana ETF on March 25. Later in April, the SEC recognized receipt of the application. Interestingly, Fidelity's fund intends to stake a percentage of its SOL holdings through reliable third-party providers, providing the possibility of yield, which is different from other filings at this time.

boxContent.title: Will the SEC Approve a Solana ETF in 2025?
boxContent.content:
Although none of these applications have received a decision from the SEC yet, perceptions have changed significantly since the beginning of 2025. Analysts think it's getting harder for the SEC to defend rejecting comparable products now that Bitcoin and Ethereum ETFs are available, particularly if they trade on authorized futures markets or have established custody and pricing infrastructures.

One of the final obstacles that needs to be overcome is regulatory classification. The SEC has not yet formally decided whether Solana is a security, and the decision-making process may be impacted by ongoing legal disputes involving other cryptocurrencies. However, ETF sponsors are revising their files in order to tackle issues, including enhanced disclosures and surveillance-sharing contracts, which were crucial in gaining approval for spot Bitcoin ETFs at the beginning of 2024.

 

Bloomberg Intelligence estimates that a spot Solana ETF may attract $3-6 billion in inflows, which makes it one of the biggest cryptocurrency ETF launches t so far. The momentum is also increased by the reality that US clearing institutions currently recognize futures ETFs linked to Solana. 

 

A significant step toward providing institutional-grade investors with access to one of the most vibrant blockchains in the cryptocurrency ecosystem would be taken if any of these Solana ETFs receive regulatory approval in the second half of 2025, as many experts now anticipate.

It is a misconception of many people that crypto trading is a game of luck, however, it is not the case. Crypto trading requires you to have good technical skills so that you can make decisions based on reading different crypto chart patterns, indicators, understanding of market sentiments, and macro economics. All these factors play an important role in the price movement of all cryptocurrencies. 

 

Whether you are analyzing the Bitcoin or Solana price prediction, understanding crypto chart patterns will help you know the current trends of the market so that you can make the right investment decisions.

boxContent.title: 1. Support and Resistance
boxContent.content:
Let's start off with the first chart pattern, which is the basic but very powerful concept of support and resistance zones. What this means is that we have a support zone when the price bounces multiple times off a certain price level. 

 

If the price keeps returning to the same level and bouncing back upward, that tells us it's a strong area of demand, or in other words, a strong support zone. It's likely that if the price meets that line again in the future, we will see another bounce from it.

 

The same goes for a resistance line, this is a price level where the market tends to get rejected multiple times. We may try to break through it, but each time the price reaches that line, it fails to go higher and turns downward again. These are touchpoints that highlight a strong resistance level. 

 

So, when the price reaches that level again, it is possible that we will see another push downward. These support and resistance zones form the foundation of technical analysis and are important for setting up entries, exits, and stop-loss levels.

boxContent.title: 2. Trend Channels
boxContent.content:
The second chart pattern, which is really useful in trading, is the trend channel, also sometimes referred to as parallel channels. We can see them appear many times during bull markets or bear markets, where the price is moving consistently in one direction inside a channel. The structure of a trend channel includes an upper resistance line and a lower support line, forming a range within which the price fluctuates.

 

In an upward trend channel, we typically observe higher lows and higher highs. This means that the market is trending up while bouncing between the upper and lower bounds of the channel. 

 

A useful strategy here is to enter a long position when the price touches the lower line of the channel and speculate that it will move upward toward the upper line. A stop loss can be placed slightly below the lower trendline in case the channel gets invalidated.

 

The same logic applies in reverse with a downward trend channel. In this case, the market is trending lower, and we see lower highs and lower lows. A trader could enter a short position when the price nears the upper line of the channel, speculating that it will reverse and go down again. 

 

Again, placing a stop loss just above the resistance line is good practice in case the pattern fails. Trend channels can be incredibly helpful in identifying optimal entry and exit points, especially in trending markets.

boxContent.title: 3. Triangles
boxContent.content:
The third chart pattern we want to discuss involves triangles, a very common and versatile formation in trading. There are three main types of triangle patterns you should be aware of:

 

1. Ascending Triangle

 

In an ascending triangle, we have a resistance line at the top and a trendline going upward from the bottom. Over time, the price forms higher lows as it pushes up toward the horizontal resistance. The price usually makes multiple attempts to break through the upper resistance line and gets rejected. But eventually, after enough pressure builds up, it breaks through that line and often results in a strong upward breakout.

 

2. Descending Triangle

 

The descending triangle is the opposite. The top line is sloping downwards, and the bottom line is flat, forming a support zone. In this pattern, the price makes lower highs and eventually gets squeezed into a tighter range. Once the price breaks below the support zone, it often leads to a strong downward move.

 

3. Symmetrical Triangle

 

In a symmetrical triangle, both the upper and lower lines are sloping towards each other, and neither is horizontal. The upper line goes down, and the lower line goes up, so the price gets squeezed more and more. Eventually, the price breaks out of the triangle.

 

Breakouts from symmetrical triangles can happen in either direction. However, it's statistically a bit more likely that the breakout will occur in the same direction that the price was moving before entering the triangle.

boxContent.title: 4. Moving Averages
boxContent.content:
Now let’s look into one of the most popular indicators used by crypto traders: the moving average. On the daily chart, this moving average can help you identify the general trend. 

 

If the price is above the 200-day moving average, we are likely in an uptrend. If the price is below it, that usually indicates a downtrend. You can also use this moving average as a dynamic support or resistance.

 

Even more useful is applying the 200-week moving average on the weekly chart. Historically, this line has been a very good indicator of market bottoms during bear markets. We can see several instances in crypto history where the price touched this line and then bounced up, marking the start of a bull market.

 

You might wonder how this moving average is calculated. In this case, on the weekly chart, the 200-period moving average takes the last 200 weekly candles and calculates their average closing price. That’s why the line appears so smooth and doesn't react sharply to sudden spikes.

boxContent.title: 5. Relative Strength Index (RSI)
boxContent.content:
Lastly, another very useful indicator is the Relative Strength Index (RSI). The RSI shows whether the market is overbought or oversold. For example, when the RSI spikes too much to the top, it’s usually a pretty good indicator that the market is overheated, and a downward correction may follow. The same logic applies when the RSI dips too far down, it signals that the market is oversold and might bounce back up.

 

Keep in mind that while RSI is not 100% accurate, it’s a very helpful tool in identifying potential tops and bottoms, especially when combined with other indicators. You can also use RSI on different time frames. 

 

For example, on the 4-hour chart, it can help you find short-term overbought or oversold conditions. If the RSI is high, it’s more likely that we’ll see a pullback. If it’s low, we might be close to a local bottom. This flexibility makes RSI useful for both day traders and long-term investors alike.

boxContent.title: History of NFTs (Non-Fungible Tokens)

boxContent.title: What are NFTs and How Do They Work?
boxContent.content:
Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs) are a special type of digital asset that can be stored on the blockchain, and the fact that they are not fungible means that they cannot be duplicated. NFTs can be anything from art to music, items of video games to a virtual land, and even real-life assets. The process of creating, storing, and managing the NFTs uses the same blockchain technology as we use in processing cryptocurrencies. 

 

A blockchain can be explained in simple words as a public digital notebook where everything is written permanently and cannot be changed. Blockchain makes NFTs unique in the same way that no one can copy or create the same NFT. Once you own an NFT, the authenticity of your ownership is recorded on the blockchain. This is one of the reasons why NFTs are considered perfect for things like digital art. 

 

In short, the most appealing thing about owning an NFT is that you own an original version of the digital asset that no one else could have or copy in any way.

boxContent.title: How to Create NFTs (Non-Fungible Tokens)?
boxContent.content:
Anyone in the world can create NFTs if they have the required mix of creativity and technical skills. The following are the steps explained on how to create NFTs.

 

Select the Preferred Art: 

 

You need to first create something very original in nature. It can be anything, like a picture, music, GIF, video, etc., and then turn them into a digital file. 

 

Create a Crypto Wallet: 

 

The next thing you need is to create a crypto wallet that will work as a digital bank account so that you can easily make transactions accordingly.

 

Pay Fees for NFT Minting:

 

Pay the gas fee using your crypto wallet for minting the NFTs. In simple words, minting refers to the process of registering your asset on the blockchain and authenticating the ownership of that NFT through a specific cryptographic address and other important details. Minting NFTs is an easy process, you just have to pay the “gas fee” to make the ownership official and authentic.

In order to sell your NFTs, you can either set a specific price for the NFT or sell it by auction.

boxContent.title: How to Sell Your NFTs?
boxContent.content:
There are three main options available when it comes to selling your NFTs in the marketplace setting a fixed price, running a timed auction, or holding an open auction. Each selling method comes with its own benefits and risks, depending on your goals as a creator of the NFT. Let’s see and discuss them one by one.  

 

1. Selling at a Fixed Price

 

Choosing a fixed price is self-explanatory. It means you set a specific fixed amount you want for your NFT. Once someone agrees to pay that price, the sale is completed.


This method is simple, predictable, and ideal if you already know the value of your NFT. You don't have to wait around for bids, instead, you set the price and wait for the right buyer to come. It's great for beginners or artists who want to avoid the factor of uncertainty that comes with auctions.

 

Key Benefits:

 

  • Fast and straightforward
  • Guaranteed earnings once sold
  • No need to monitor bids constantly

 

2. Running a Timed Auction

 

In a timed auction, you set a starting price and a time limit. Buyers have to place the bids as per their choice, however, it should be higher than the starting price fixed by the seller of the NFT. Furthermore, buyers have to place the bid within the time limi set by the seller. The highest bidder wins the NFT when the auction ends.

 

You can set up a "Dutch Auction," where you start with a high price, and over time, the price gradually drops until someone decides to buy. This format creates excitement among the buyers and can drive up the value of your NFT if there are multiple bidders showing their interest in buying.

 

Key Benefits:

 

  • Potential to earn more if bidding becomes competitive
  • Creates urgency among buyers
  • Good for rare or highly desirable NFTs

 

3. Starting an Open or Unlimited Auction

 

Some platforms allow an open-ended auction with no minimum starting price. Here, anyone can place a bid, and there’s no time limit. You can accept any offer you like whenever you feel it’s fair.

 

However, this method of auction comes with the maximum risk factor, because bids might start very low, it can also reveal the true market value of your NFT. If your work is unique or in high demand, open auctions can sometimes lead to unexpectedly high offers.

 

Key Benefits:

 

  • Find out the real market demand for your NFT
  • Flexible: you control when to accept a bid
  • Opportunity for higher profits if your NFT gets popular

 

Which Selling Method Should You Choose?

 

The best way to sell your NFT depends on your strategy. If you want quick, predictable income, fixed pricing might be your best bet. If you are confident that your NFT will attract multiple buyers, an auction could push the price higher.


And if you are open to a little risk and curiosity about your NFT’s true worth, an open auction could be the way to go.

 

No matter which method you choose, understanding the pros and cons will help you get the most value from your digital creation.

boxContent.title: What Is a Crypto Day Trading Strategy?
boxContent.content:
Day Trading is one of the crypto trading strategies where traders make small amounts of profit with little price movements. This strategy normally includes opening and closing the trade within the same day. For example, you opened the trade at 1:00 pm and closed it at 8:00 pm. It can be any time, but it should be within the time period of the same day. 

 

There is no official timing of opening and closing the market, like we see in traditional markets. Cryptocurrency markets are open 24 hours a day and 7 days a week, so without time restrictions, traders have the opportunity to choose a suitable time for day trading. That is the beauty of a day trading crypto strategy, where traders can choose the best timeframe to trade and make a profit within a day. 

 

However, implementing day trading strategies is not as easy as it seems. It requires proper research on the market trend, technical analysis, price analysis, current market sentiments, latest news, and economic meetings. Make sure that you have a good knowledge of all these key factors for positive results through a day trading strategy.

boxContent.title: How Beginners Can Start Day Trading Crypto?
boxContent.content:
It doesn’t matter if you are a beginner or a professional trader; you need to have a clear trading strategy every time, regardless of the type of strategy. The following are some of the important suggestions and steps that will help you significantly implement the day trading strategy in cryptocurrency. 

 

Select a Suitable Time Period 

 

You need to select the time frame based on your trading objectives and availability. For example, there are 4 most popular and significant intervals that most traders use for day trading, including charts for 15, 30, and 60 minutes, and 4 hours. The short time frame of the chart allows you to make a profit instantly, while the longer time period requires broader technical and price analysis. 

 

Conduct Technical and Price Analysis 

 

Technical and price analysis is the cornerstone of day trading. Once you have learned to read and analyse the candlesticks and understand the patterns, you can make sound decisions based on data analysis and current market sentiments. 

 

There are plenty of indicators that allow you to conclude the patterns and take the right trading decisions at the right time. Bollinger Bands, Aroon, Average True Range, and Commodity Channel Index are some of the many significant indicators. 

 

Prepare for Risk Management

 

Risk management is one of the key factors to consider when it comes to trading cryptocurrencies, commodities, or any other digital asset. Always make sure that you set SL (Stop Loss) and TP (Take Profit) for every trade you open. 

 

This will allow you to manage your risk significantly without losing all your capital within a single trade. Make sure you only risk your capital in the range of 1% to 2% on a single day of trading. Assess the level of your risk tolerance so that you can set clear boundaries.

boxContent.title: How Much a Crypto Day Trader Can Earn?
boxContent.content:
The amount of profit a day trader can earn is entirely dependent on the level of skills, experience, capital, and the currency conditions of the market. There are traders who make hundreds and thousands of dollars every day, while some also face big losses with the intraday trading strategy. The following are some of the factors that determine the profitability of the trades. 

 

  • The highly volatile crypto makes the most effective price movements and creates a lot of profit opportunities for the traders. 

 

  • Profit earned by day traders depends on the boundaries you set for every trade and the amount of capital you have in the account. 

 

  • Strategies with high frequency can make small but consistent profits. One such strategy is Scalping, however, it demands regular discipline and great focus throughout the trading sessions.

boxContent.content:
Choosing the right cryptocurrency for day trading is very important. There are certain factors that you must consider in a cryptocurrency before implementing the day trading strategy. Let’s see and discuss these factors one by one.

 

Highly Volatile In Nature 

 

Make sure that you choose a cryptocurrency for day trading that is highly volatile in nature. For example, BTC and ETH are popular because of their quick price movements within a day. The highly volatile cryptos allow you to lock in the gains within a short period of time. 

 

Highly Liquidate

 

High liquidity in the crypto market means that you can buy or sell cryptocurrencies quickly without causing a big change in the price. This shows that there are many sellers and buyers of that specific cryptocurrency in the market that can impact the price movement of the coin. 

 

Large Market Capitalization 

 

Cryptos with highest market cap are considered to be more stable than those that dive in one direction instantly. It is not only good for beginners but also for expert and experienced traders in the market. These types of digital assets give a secure entry point for day traders. 

 

Market Sentiments 

 

Make sure that you stay updated with the latest news and events that have the potential to impact the entire crypto market and directly to the crypto you are investing in. boxContent.title: Is It Legal to Implement The Day Trading Crypto Strategy?

boxContent.title: What are The Other Effective Strategies for Crypto Trading?
boxContent.content:
The following are some of the top crypto strategies other than day trading. Let’s see them one by one. 

 

Moving Average Crossovers

 

Traders use Moving Average Crossovers to identify changes in the trends of the cryptocurrency. This strategy tracks two moving averages: one that responds quickly to price changes (like the 50-day average) and one that moves slowly (like the 200-day average). 

 

When the faster average crosses above the slower one, it may signal a buying opportunity, suggesting prices might rise. However, when the faster average drops below the slower one, traders often see it as a reason to sell. This method helps traders catch momentum shifts without constantly watching the charts.

 

Relative Strength Index (RSI)

 

The Relative Strength Index helps traders determine if a cryptocurrency is overbought or oversold. The RSI is a number between 0 and 100, with two key levels: 70 and 30. If the RSI goes above 70, the asset might be too expensive and due for a price drop. 

 

If it falls below 30, the price might be too low and ready for a rebound. RSI doesn't predict the future but gives helpful hints about potential market reversals. Many traders use it alongside other tools to support their trading choices.

 

Event-Driven Trading

 

Event-driven trading is based on price changes caused by news or major events in the crypto market. This can include exchange listings, new regulations, partnerships, or tweets from influential people. Traders using this strategy stay alert to announcements and act fast to take advantage of price spikes or drops. 

 

The main objective is to benefit from market reactions before things stabilize. Since news can quickly affect the market, this strategy works best for people who can follow crypto developments in real-time.

 

Scalping

 

Scalping focuses on making small, quick profits throughout the day. Instead of holding onto a coin for a long time, scalpers enter and exit trades within minutes or seconds. They look for small price changes and high volume to build gains. 

 

This strategy requires careful attention to charts and quick decision-making. While each trade may bring just a small profit, consistent trading can add up. Scalping is not for everyone; it requires a lot of focus and fast reflexes.

 

Dollar Cost Averaging (DCA)

 

Dollar Cost Averaging, or DCA, is a simple and steady way to invest in crypto. Instead of trying to find the perfect time to buy, you invest a fixed amount of money at regular intervals, like every week or month, regardless of the price. 

 

Over time, this helps lower your average purchase cost and reduces the risk of buying everything at a high price. It’s a great strategy for beginners or anyone who wants to avoid the stress of timing the market. DCA helps you stay consistent and committed to your long-term investment plan.
